subject: Why must test methods return void?
msgSnippet: After over 10 years of using JUnit, it has only just struck me that test methods must return void, but why? I ve just come across an example where a particular
messageBody:
After over 10 years of using JUnit, it has only just struck me that test methods must return void, but why?

I've just come across an example where a particular test did a lot of work, and I wanted to piggy-back on its final state by calling the method from another test. Is there any fundamental reason for not allowing me to return values? It might even be an opportunity to write an annotation expressing constraints about the value returned.

Cheers

Duncan McGregor
